required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 14, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: COVID-19 Infection and Epithelial Cell Markers
clinical_study.official_title: COVID-19 Infection and Epithelial Cell Markers

brief_summary.textblock: To assess if TSLP expression by airway epithelial cells following COVID-19 infection regulates viral load and disease severity.

detailed_description.textblock: The study aim is to determine the relationship between COVID-19 infection and epithelial cell expression of TSLP. Two cohorts will be used. Cohort One will include 100 hospitalized patients with Covid-19, and 100 hospitalized patients without Covid-19. Cohort 2 will include mild/moderate asthmatics and healthy controls with bio-banked biopsy material used from donors who have previously consented for samples to be used for future research.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Compare the level of TSLP expression in nasal epithelium in patients with and without COVID-19 infection

secondary_outcome.description: Epithelial cell expression (protein staining) of TSLP in endobronchial biopsy tissue of asthmatic patients versus normal controls.
Epithelial cell expression (protein staining) of IL-33 in endobronchial biopsy tissue of asthmatic patients versus normal controls.

secondary_outcome.measure: ACE-2 receptor expression in endobronchial biopsies
secondary_outcome.description: Epithelial cell expression (protein staining) of ACE-2 receptor in endobronchial biopsy tissue of asthmatic patients versus normal controls.

arm_group.description: 100 patients hospitalized with Covid-19, and 100 hospitalized controls without Covid-19
20 asthmatic patients, 10 patients with asthma and allergic rhinitis, and 5 healthy controls.

biospec_descr.textblock: Blood TSLP levels will be measured and SNP genotyping for alarmins will be performed from Cohort 1 patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 18 years and above;
- Able to give informed consent;
- Clinically tested for SARS-CoV-2 (as completed by standard laboratory testing e.g. RT-PCR) and with a positive result and clinical features in keeping with COVID-19 illness. The control group will be patients with a negative RT-PCR COVID-19 test and without any clinical features to suggest COVID-19 illness. In addition, the control group should have NO known or current features of respiratory infection, COPD, asthma, interstitial lung disease, other respiratory inflammatory conditions or lung cancer.
- Able to provide a breath sample (as based on clinical judgement).
Exclusion Criteria:
- none
